17.0: MISHNAH: One does not sit down before the barber, close to the time of the afternoon prayer, unless he has already said his prayer. Neither shall he enter the bath house or a tannery, or sit down to eat or begin a law suit;
17.2: One interrupts for the reading of the Shema', but not for the prayer (the 'Amida.
17.17: Thus one may not enter the bathhouse if only for sweating. Why not at the outset? Because one may faint.
